subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: {{Han simp|殘|f=戔|t=㦮}} for Japanese shinjitai and {{Han simp|殘|f=戔|t=戋|nocap=y}} for simplified Chinese.

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: Note that Japanese shinjitai uses {{l|mul|㦮}} (extra line above {{l|mul|戋}}) while simplified Chinese uses {{l|mul|戋}}. Due to {{w|Han unification}}, both {{w|simplified Chinese}} and Japanese {{w|shinjitai}} forms are encoded under the same [[code point]]. Different forms can be observed when using the appropriate font.

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|[[𣸶]]}} ''(Based on China glyph form containing {{l|mul|戋}})'' <!-- The official Unicode chart contains 戋 for this derived character -->

subSections.title: Readings
Affix
